tree

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • tree.Node

  • public class Node
extends Object
    Representation of a node in a tree of game.action for QWOP. Most of the tree management stuff is handled by recursing through up and down the linked connections of nodes. All nodes past the root node contain a game state and the single action since the previous node taken to get there. The root node is the same, except it has only a state and not an action associated with it.

    The convention "up the tree" is used to mean towards the root node, or towards lower tree depth. "Down the tree" means towards the leaves, or to greater tree depth.

    Author:
    matt

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Action action
      Action which takes the game from the parent node's state to this node's state.
      boolean displayPoint
      Should a round dot be displayed at each node? The color will be determined by nodeColor or overrideNodeColor, if set.
      AtomicBoolean fullyExplored
      Are there any untried things below this node? This is not necessarily a TERMINAL node, it is simply a node past which there are no potential child game.action to try.

      Maximum depth anywhere below this node in the tree.

    • Field Detail

      • action

        public final Action action
        Action which takes the game from the parent node's state to this node's state.

      • visitCount

        public AtomicLong visitCount
        Some sampling methods want to track how many times this node has been visited during tree sampling.

      • maxBranchDepth

        public final AtomicInteger maxBranchDepth
        Maximum depth anywhere below this node in the tree. The tree root is 0.

      • potentialActionGenerator

        public static IActionGenerator potentialActionGenerator
        If assigned, this automatically adds potential game.action to children when they are created. This makes the functionality a little more like the old version which selected from a fixed pool of durations for each action in the sequence. This time, the action generator can use anything arbitrary to decide what the potential children are, and the potentialActionGenerator can be hot swapped at any point.

      • uncheckedActions

        public ActionSet uncheckedActions
        Untried child game.action.

      • fullyExplored

        public final AtomicBoolean fullyExplored
        Are there any untried things below this node? This is not necessarily a TERMINAL node, it is simply a node past which there are no potential child game.action to try.

      • displayPoint

        public boolean displayPoint
        Should a round dot be displayed at each node? The color will be determined by nodeColor or overrideNodeColor, if set. By default, only lines are shown.

      • overrideLineColor

        public Color overrideLineColor
        Tree node connection line color override. Will override the default gradient coloring with this color if not null. If null, the default depth-based coloring will be used. No lines drawn regardless if displayLine is false.

      • overrideNodeColor

        public Color overrideNodeColor
        Tree node dot color override. Will override the default node color if this field is not null and displayPoint is true. is true.

      • nodeColor

        public Color nodeColor
        Default node point color. Will not be drawn if displayPoint is not true. Can also be overridden by overrideNodeColor.

      • nodeColorValue

        public boolean nodeColorValue

      • maxVal

        public static float maxVal

      • minVal

        public static float minVal

      • nodeLabel

        public String nodeLabel

      • nodeLabelAlt

        public String nodeLabelAlt

      • pointsToDraw

        public static final Set<Node> pointsToDraw

      • notDrawnForSpeed

        public boolean notDrawnForSpeed
        Specifies whether this node has been ignored for drawing purposes. This only gets manipulated if limitDrawing is true.

      • includeZOffsetInDrawFiltering

        public static boolean includeZOffsetInDrawFiltering

      • nodeLocation

        public float[] nodeLocation
        Parameters for visualizing the tree

    • Constructor Detail

      • Node

        public Node(Node parent,
            Action action)
        Make a new node which is NOT the root. Add this to the tree hierarchy.

      • Node

        public Node(Node parent,
            Action action,
            boolean connectNodeToTree)
        Make a new node which is NOT the root. connectNodeToTree is the default.
        Parameters:
        parent - Parent node of this new node to be created.
        action - Action associated with the new node which takes the parent node's state to this node's state.
        connectNodeToTree - Whether this node is connected to the tree, i.e. does the parent node know about this child.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Trying to add a node with the same action as another in the parent.

      • Node

        public Node()
        Make the root of a new tree.

    • Method Detail

      • addChild

        public Node addChild(Action childAction)
        Add a new child node from a given action. If the action is in uncheckedActions, remove it.
        Parameters:
        childAction - The action which defines a child node, i.e. it takes this node's state to the new child's state.
        Returns:
        A new child node defined by the provided action.

      • reserveExpansionRights

        public boolean reserveExpansionRights()
        Set a flag to indicate that the invoking TreeWorker has temporary exclusive rights to expand from this node.
        Returns:
        Whether the lock was successfully obtained. True means that the caller obtained the lock. False means that someone else got to it first.

      • releaseExpansionRights

        public void releaseExpansionRights()
        Set a flag to indicate that the invoking TreeWorker has released exclusive rights to expand from this node.

      • isLocked

        public boolean isLocked()
        Determine whether any sampler has exclusive rights to sample from this node.
        Returns:
        Whether any worker has exclusive rights to expand from this node (true/false).

      • getValue

        public float getValue()
        Get the node's value in a thread-safe way. The value or 'score' is totally at the discretion of the sampler. The node value is 0 until otherwise set.
        Returns:
        A score/cost/value associated with this node.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(float val)
        Set the node's value in a thread-safe way. The sampler must decide how to use this.
        Parameters:
        val - A new value for this node.

      • addToValue

        public void addToValue(float val)
        Add to the node's existing value in a thread-safe way. The sampler must decide how to use this.
        Parameters:
        val - A value to add to this node's existing value.

      • getParent

        public Node getParent()
        Get the parent node of this node. If called from root, will return null.
        Returns:
        Parent node of this node.

      • getChildren

        public Node[] getChildren()
        Get the children of this node.
        Returns:
        A copy of the list of children of this node. Removing the nodes from this array will not remove them from this node's actual children, but the nodes in the array are the originals.

      • removeFromChildren

        public void removeFromChildren(Node node)
        Remove a node from this node's list of children if the node is present. Do NOT use this method lightly. Usually want to do something else.
        Parameters:
        node - Child node to remove.

      • getIndexAccordingToParent

        public int getIndexAccordingToParent()
        Get the index of this node in it's parent list of nodes. Hence, parent.children.get(index) == this.
        Returns:
        This node's index in its parent's list of nodes.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - When called on a root node (depth 0).

      • getSiblingCount

        public int getSiblingCount()
        Get the number of siblings, i.e. other nodes in this node's parent's list of children. Does not include this node itself.
        Returns:
        Number of sibling nodes of this one.

      • getChildCount

        public int getChildCount()
        Get the total number of children of this node. Only includes actually created children, not potential children . Only includes direct children, not all descendants.
        Returns:
        Total created children of this node.

      • getChildByIndex

        public Node getChildByIndex(int childIndex)
        Get a created child node of this node by its index (order of creation).
        Parameters:
        childIndex - Index of the child node to retrieve.
        Returns:
        A child of this node, with the index as specified.

      • getRandomChild

        public Node getRandomChild()
        Get a random already-created child of this node. Can be useful for sampling.
        Returns:
        A random child node of this node.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Has no children.

      • getNodesBelow

        public List<Node> getNodesBelow(List<Node> nodeList,
                                boolean includeOnlyNodesWithState)
        Add all the nodes below and including this one to a list. Does not include nodes whose state have not yet been assigned.
        Parameters:
        nodeList - A list to add all of this branches' nodes to. This list must be caller-provided, and will not be cleared.
        includeOnlyNodesWithState - If true, this will only get nodes which have a state assigned to them.
        Returns:
        Returns the list of nodes below. This is done in place, so the object is the same as the argument one.

      • getLeaves

        public List<Node> getLeaves(List<Node> leaves)
        Get a list of all tree endpoints (leaves) below this node, i.e. on this branch. If called from a leaf, the list will only contain that leaf itself.
        Parameters:
        leaves - A list of leaves below this node. The list must be provided by the caller, and will not be cleared by this method.
        Returns:
        Returns the list of nodes below. This is done in place, so the object is the same as the argument one.

      • getRoot

        public Node getRoot()
        Returns the tree root no matter which node in the tree this is called from. This method defines the tree root to be the node with a depth of 0.
        Returns:
        The tree root node.

      • countDescendants

        public int countDescendants()
        Count the number of descendants this node has.
        Returns:
        Number of descendants, i.e. number of nodes on the branch below this node.

      • isOtherNodeAncestor

        public boolean isOtherNodeAncestor(Node possibleAncestorNode)
        Check whether a node is an ancestor of this node. This means that there is a direct path from this node to the given node that only requires decreasing tree depth.
        Parameters:
        possibleAncestorNode - Node to check whether is an ancestor of this node.
        Returns:
        Whether the provided node is an ancestor of this node (true/false).

      • propagateFullyExploredStatus_lite

        public void propagateFullyExploredStatus_lite()
        Change whether this node or any above it have become fully explored. Generally called from a leaf node which has just been assigned fully-explored status, and we need to propagate the effects back up the tree.

        This is the "lite" version because it assumes that all child nodes it encounters have correct fully-explored statuses already assigned. This should be true during normal operation, but when a bunch of saved nodes are imported, it is useful to do a complete check.

      • destroyNodesBelowAndCheckExplored

        public void destroyNodesBelowAndCheckExplored()
        Destroy a branch and try to free up its memory. Mark the trimmed branch as fully explored and propagate the status. This method can be useful when the sampler or user decides that one branch is bad and wants to keep it from being used later in sampling.

      • destroyNodesBelow

        public void destroyNodesBelow()
        Try to de-reference everything on this branch so garbage collection throws out all the state values and other info stored for this branch to keep memory in check.

      • getTotalNodeCount

        public static long getTotalNodeCount()
        Get the number of nodes in this or any tree.
        Returns:
        Total number of nodes, both imported and created.

      • getImportedNodeCount

        public static long getImportedNodeCount()
        Get the number of nodes imported from save file.
        Returns:
        Number of nodes imported from a save file.

      • getCreatedNodeCount

        public static long getCreatedNodeCount()
        Get the total number of nodes created this session.
        Returns:
        Number of nodes created during this execution.

      • getImportedGameCount

        public static long getImportedGameCount()
        Get the total number of games (not nodes) imported from save file.
        Returns:
        Number of imported games.

      • isFailed

        public boolean isFailed()
        Does this node represent a failed state?
        Returns:
        Whether this node represents a failed state (true/false).

      • setFailed

        public void setFailed(boolean failed)
        Manually set that this node represents a failed state. Failure status will be automatically set when assigning this node a state and does not need to be manually done. Only useful if we want to assign failure status without assigning a state.
        Parameters:
        failed - Whether this node should represent a failed state.

      • setState

        public void setState(State newState)
        Assign a state to this node. This state should represent the state after performing this node's action from its parent's node's state.
        Parameters:
        newState - State to assign to this node.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Trying to assign a state to this node when one is already assigned.

      • getState

        public State getState()
        Get the game state associated with this node. Represents the state achieved from the parent node's state after performing the action in this node.
        Returns:
        Game state at this node.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If state is unassigned.

      • isStateUnassigned

        public boolean isStateUnassigned()
        Check whether a game state has been assigned to this node.
        Returns:
        Whether the game state is assigned or not. True means not yet assigned.

      • getAction

        public Action getAction()
        Get the action object (most likely keypress + duration) that leads to this node from its parent.
        Returns:
        This node's action.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When called on a root node (tree depth of 0).

      • getSequence

        public Action[] getSequence()
        Get the sequence of game.action up to, and including this node.
        Returns:
        An array of game.action which, when executed from the initial state will lead to the state at this node.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If called on the root node.

      • makeNodesFromRunInfo

        public static Node makeNodesFromRunInfo(List<SavableSingleGame> runs,
                                        Node existingRootToAddTo,
                                        int trimActionAddingToDepth)

      • stripUncheckedActionsExceptOnLeaves

        public static void stripUncheckedActionsExceptOnLeaves(Node node,
                                                       int minDepth)
        Helper for node adding from file. Clears unchecked game.action from non-leaf nodes. Only does it for things below minDepth. Forces new building to happen only at the boundaries of this.

      • makeNodesFromActionSequences

        public static void makeNodesFromActionSequences(List<Action[]> game.action,
                                                Node root,
                                                GameThreadSafe game)
        Add nodes based on saved action sequences. Has to re-simulate each to get the states.

      • calcNodePosBelow

        public void calcNodePosBelow()
        Recalculate all node positions below this one (NOT including this one for the sake of root).

      • resetSweepAngle

        public void resetSweepAngle()
        Resets the angle at which child nodes will fan out from this node in the visualization. This must be done before the children are created. The angle is set to 3pi/2.

      • postPruneDrawingBelow

        public void postPruneDrawingBelow(float threshold)
        Update which nodes are being drawn based on a distance threshold from other nodes. This is usually done automatically, but sometimes it's nice to aggressively prune areas of the tree which aren't important any more.
        Parameters:
        threshold - Distance squared threshold. Nodes closer to another drawn node than this threshold are not drawn.

      • drawLines_below

        public void drawLines_below(com.jogamp.opengl.GL2 gl)
        Draw all lines in the subtree below this node.
        Parameters:
        gl - OpenGL drawing object.

      • drawNodes_below

        public void drawNodes_below(com.jogamp.opengl.GL2 gl)
        Draw all nodes in the subtree below this node.
        Parameters:
        gl - OpenGL drawing object.

      • turnOffBranchDisplay

        public void turnOffBranchDisplay()
        Turn off all display for this node onward.

      • highlightSingleRunToThisNode

        public void highlightSingleRunToThisNode()
        Single out one run up to this node to highlight the lines, while dimming the others.

      • setLineBrightness_below

        public void setLineBrightness_below(float brightness)
        Fade a certain part of the tree.

      • resetLineBrightness_below

        public void resetLineBrightness_below()
        Reset line brightnesses to default.

      • getColorFromTreeDepth

        public static Color getColorFromTreeDepth(int depth)
        Color the node scaled by depth in the tree. Totally for gradient pleasantness.

      • getColorFromScaledValue

        public static Color getColorFromScaledValue(float val,
                                            float max,
                                            float brightness)

      • setChildrenColorFromRelativeValues

        public void setChildrenColorFromRelativeValues()

      • setBranchColor

        public void setBranchColor(Color newColor)
        Set an override line color for this branch (all descendants).

      • setBackwardsBranchColor

        public void setBackwardsBranchColor(Color newColor)
        Set an override line color for this path (all ancestors).

      • clearBranchColor

        public void clearBranchColor()
        Clear an overridden line color on this branch. Call from root to get all line colors back to default.

      • clearBackwardsBranchColor

        public void clearBackwardsBranchColor()
        Clear an overridden line color on this branch. Goes back towards root.

      • clearNodeOverrideColor

        public void clearNodeOverrideColor()
        Clear all node override colors from this node onward. Call from root to clear all.

      • setBranchZOffset

        public void setBranchZOffset(float zOffset)
        Give this branch a nodeLocationZOffset to make it stand out.

      • setBackwardsBranchZOffset

        public void setBackwardsBranchZOffset(float zOffset)
        Give this branch a nodeLocationZOffset to make it stand out. Goes backwards towards root.

      • clearBackwardsBranchZOffset

        public void clearBackwardsBranchZOffset()
        Clear z offsets in this branch. Works backwards towards root.

      • clearBranchZOffset

        public void clearBranchZOffset()
        Clear z offsets in this branch. Called from root, it resets all back to 0.

      • getTreeDepth

        public int getTreeDepth()
        How deep is this node down the tree? 0 is root.

      • recurseOnTreeInclusive

        public void recurseOnTreeInclusive(Consumer<Node> operation)
        Can pass a lambda to recurse down the tree. Will include the node called.
        Parameters:
        operation - Lambda to run on all the nodes in the branch below and including the node called upon.

      • recurseOnTreeExclusive

        public void recurseOnTreeExclusive(Consumer<Node> operation)
        Can pass a lambda to recurse down the tree. Will NOT include the node called.
        Parameters:
        operation - Lambda to run on all the nodes in the branch below and excluding the node called upon.
